description: Arrange the governed data product creation steps in the correct order.
instructions: Think about building a governed data product: What quality of data serves business users? What standardizes terminology? Pattern: curated data → business metrics → access control → contracts → discoverability → AI access.

blocks.code: Create curated Gold table with business-quality data (cleaned, aggregated)
blocks.label: Prepare Gold Table

blocks.code: Create SQL views defining standard metrics (net_revenue, customer_ltv, churn_rate)
blocks.label: Define Metric Layer

blocks.code: Create dynamic views with row-level security: WHERE business_unit = current_user_attribute('bu')
blocks.label: Implement Row-Level Security

blocks.code: Define data contract: required columns, NOT NULL constraints, freshness SLA (< 1 hour)
blocks.label: Establish Data Contract

blocks.code: Add COMMENT, tags, and documentation. Mark as 'Published' in Catalog Explorer
blocks.label: Publish Data Product

blocks.code: Configure AI/BI Genie with metric instructions and table descriptions for NL queries
blocks.label: Enable Genie Access

hints: Clean, curated data is the foundation of any data product
Metric definitions standardize business language before exposing data
Row-level security is applied before publishing to ensure governance
Data contracts define the stability guarantees downstream consumers rely on
Publishing adds documentation and makes the data discoverable
Genie is the final consumer-facing layer for natural language access
learnings: Gold tables are the foundation of the semantic layer
Data products package assets for consumers
AI/BI Genie enables natural language queries
